issue.title: protobuf ParseFromString function return value not checked

content.raw:
I ran the `issue_1022_throw` branch over the weekend, and I didn't catch many instances of this error (roughly 2 test failures for every 30 calls to `make test`), but I did catch [one with a backtrace](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/93d37daf8ad7699bc72a). The failure occurred during the second test in `INTEGRATION_pr2` when [Master.cc tried to parse a message](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/32287918490425e4f9fd5a06fbca3ade3e95f55d/gazebo/Master.cc#cl-142). Just prior to this failure, there were also some console messages about `Connection.hh:266 Header is empty`. Looking at [that part of the code](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/32287918490425e4f9fd5a06fbca3ade3e95f55d/gazebo/transport/Connection.hh#cl-266), there is a comment that says "[We should never get here](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/32287918490425e4f9fd5a06fbca3ade3e95f55d/gazebo/transport/Connection.hh#cl-268)".

@caguero any thoughts?
content.html:
I ran the issue_1022_throw branch over the weekend, and I didn't catch many instances of this error (roughly 2 test failures for every 30 calls to make test), but I did catch one with a backtrace. The failure occurred during the second test in INTEGRATION_pr2 when Master.cc tried to parse a message. Just prior to this failure, there were also some console messages about Connection.hh:266 Header is empty. Looking at that part of the code, there is a comment that says "We should never get here".

@caguero any thoughts?
